adjectives.description: aspirated (comparative more aspirated, superlative most aspirated)

entries.meaning: (phonetics) Pronounced with an audible breath, a brief expulsion of air at the end of the sound.
examples: In English, word-initial single voiceless consonants are aspirated, so that pit is pronounced [pʰɪt] but spit is pronounced [spɪt].
In Cambodian, aspiration is phonemic, so /p/ and /pʰ/ are different phonemes.

entries.meaning: (French linguistics) In French, describing an initial letter h which, though silent, does not permit liaison or elision with the preceding word.
examples: The h in haine is aspirated, so one says la haine, not l'haine.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of aspirate
